keyword.ja: 計算機科学：数式処理および準数値アルゴリズム。これらを主たる対象とした高性能計算の応用（並列処理）。自動証明や証明支援システムの応用。これらに関するソフトウェアの開発。WEB技術のこれらへの応用
keyword.en: Computer Science: Algorithms for seminumerical algorithms and high-performence computing mainly in these application areas. System software and development of WEB technologies in these areas.

committee_name.ja: 大会・分科会等研究会担当理事、代表会員

paper_title.en: GPU-acceleration of optimal permutation-puzzle solving

description.en: We first investigate parallelization of Rubik's cube optimal solver, especially for acceleration by GPU. To examine its efficacy, we implement a simple solver based on Korf's algorithm, with which CPU and GPU collaborate in IDA∗algorithm and a large number of GPU cores are utilized for speedup instead of a huge distance table used for pruning. Empirical studies succeeded to attain sufficient speedup by GPU-acceleration. There are many other similar puzzles of so-called permutation puzzles. The puzzle solving, i.e., restoring the original ordered state from a scrambled one is equivalent to the pathfinding in the Cayley graph of the permutation group. We generalize the method used for Rubik's cube to much smaller problems, and examine its efficacy. The focus of our research interest is how efficient the parallel path-finding can be and whether the use of a large number of cores substitutes for a large distance table used for pruning, in general.

paper_title.en: BrEdiMa: Yet Another Web-browser Tool for Mathematical Expressions
Experiment of multithreading symbolic and algebraic computations with OpenMP

description.en: This paper describes the current status of a project for multithreading algebraic computations, which aims at the utilization of today's high-spec PCs with hyperthreading or dual-core technologies. Our effort is done by applying OpenXM with minimal cost of development, and includes memory management in multithreaded environment. Our empirical results show that the performance gain can be attained in numeric cases and in some cases of purely symbolic computations.

paper_title.ja: ωビット消去による拡張GCD問題の解法 －逆元計算の一高速化手法－
paper_title.en: ωビット消去による拡張GCD問題の解法 －逆元計算の一高速化手法－

description.ja: This paper presents a new algorithm for the extended integer GCD problem, which is often refered to for computing modular reciprocals, and has been being investigated rigorously. We apply the multi-bit elimination algorithm, recently developed for the integer GCD problem, to the extended problem. We show that the application cannot be straightforward, and there arise two problems related with exact division. To resolve these problems, we also apply the bit elimination algorithm. A brief discussion about implementation will be also given.
description.en: This paper presents a new algorithm for the extended integer GCD problem, which is often refered to for computing modular reciprocals, and has been being investigated rigorously. We apply the multi-bit elimination algorithm, recently developed for the integer GCD problem, to the extended problem. We show that the application cannot be straightforward, and there arise two problems related with exact division. To resolve these problems, we also apply the bit elimination algorithm. A brief discussion about implementation will be also given.

paper_title.ja: Vector Processing in Symbolic Determinant Expansion on Supercomputer
paper_title.en: Vector Processing in Symbolic Determinant Expansion on Supercomputer
VECTORIZATION OF SYMBOLIC DETERMINANT CALCULATION

description.en: Data objects in computer algebra systems, representing formulas, are of variable sizes and structures even for numbers, and furthermore, as calculation proceeds, they grow often explosively and sometimes much more than the final results. For this reason, the current computer algebra systems, which always suffer from lack of memory space and a large amount of computing time. Our intention is to apply supercomputers to symbolic determinant calculation, and to largely extend the practically computable size of matrices. In empirical tests, the determinants of such large matrices of dimensions greater-than-or-equal-to 100, whose determinants can never be computed on the existing computer algebra systems, can be expanded within a reasonable amount of time.
